title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. The amendment increases the credit percentage for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to 50 percent. There is no dollar limitation for property related to hydrogen. The credit is allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. The amendment increases the credit percentage for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to 50 percent, with no dollar limitation. It includes specified off-highway vehicles for the storage or dispensing of hydrogen fuel. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' includes all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding farm tractors and certain other equipment. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' excludes farm tractors and certain equipment. Credit for hydrogen property extended through 2016. Amendments apply to property placed in service after enactment in taxable years ending after that date. The amendment made by subsection (c) applies to property placed in service after the enactment of the Act in taxable years ending after that date. The repeal of limitation in subsection (b) applies to taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. The amendment in subsection (d) regarding hydrogen refueling property applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50% credit for qualified fuel cell property in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency of 70% or more, and a 40% credit for systems with an energy efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70%. The text chunk discusses amendments to the tax code related to the investment credit for fuel cell property. It includes changes to the energy efficiency requirements and maximum credit amounts. The amendment increases the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property placed in service, with specific amounts based on the capacity of the property. The amendment increases the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property placed in service, with specific amounts based on the capacity of the property. The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
